metadata.siteDescription: The professional portfolio of Asif Rabnawaz, a Computer Science with Cybersecurity graduate from the University of Salford.

personalInfo.name: Asif Rabnawaz
personalInfo.title: Computer Science with Cyber Security Graduate

text: Computer Science with Cybersecurity graduate (First-Class Honours) from the University of Salford, with hands-on experience in software development and cybersecurity from academic projects and team collaborations.
Proficient in Python, Java, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL, and skilled in Agile methodologies, secure web application development, and implementing robust cybersecurity measures.

I am eager to apply my technical knowledge and collaborative spirit in a professional software development or cybersecurity role to contribute to impactful projects while continuing my professional learning.

responsibilities: Delivered exceptional customer service and trained new staff on tills and store operations.
Developed robust problem-solving and teamwork skills in a fast-paced environment.
Addressed customer issues with patience and professionalism.
Led a five-member Agile team to develop a secure Communications Dashboard Web Application.
Managed three iterative sprints and conducted four client demonstrations to ensure timely delivery.
Utilised Microsoft Teams and GitHub for task coordination and version control.
Assisted customers with banking machines, enhancing communication skills by explaining processes clearly.
Improved customer confidence by demonstrating transactions such as paying bills and withdrawing money.

content.title: CollaboCraft – Academic Productivity Platform
description: Developed a full-featured, web-based academic management tool using an MVC framework. The platform includes features like collaborative note-taking, scheduling, and integrated project management to help students organize their work.

The secondary goal of the project was to explore secure coding practices, ensuring that all user data was handled with care and protected against common web vulnerabilities. This involved implementing secure authentication and authorization mechanisms.

content.title: Borrow My Charger
description: Designed a user-friendly interface for a conceptual peer-to-peer car charger rental service. The primary focus was on creating an intuitive user experience, from locating a charger on the map to completing the rental process.
Integrated a map view for locating available car chargers and engineered a script to generate and manage over one thousand mock user data entries for realistic testing and demonstration purposes.

media.alt: A user profile screen within the application.
media.caption: User profiles and rental management.

media.alt: A short demo video of the map view.
media.caption: Users can easily locate nearby chargers.

items.degree: BSc (Hons) in Computer Science with Cyber Security
notes: Gained expertise in Object-Oriented Programming, Network Security, and various Cybersecurity Tools.
Skilled in Agile methodologies and modern software development practices.

items.degree: BTEC Nationals Extended Diploma in IT
notes: Awarded Most Supportive Student of the year 2019.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: I'm always open to discussing new projects, creative ideas, or opportunities to be part of your visions. Feel free to reach out!
